project.component: { "keyToString": { "CMake Application.LifeSim.executor": "Run", "CMake Debug.LifeSim.executor": "Debug", "Docker.CLion Profiler Toolchain.executor": "Run", "RunOnceActivity.RadMigrateCodeStyle": "true", "RunOnceActivity.ShowReadmeOnStart": "true", "RunOnceActivity.cidr.known.project.marker": "true", "RunOnceActivity.readMode.enableVisualFormatting": "true", "cf.advertisement.text.has.clang-format": "true", "cf.first.check.clang-format": "false", "cidr.known.project.marker": "true", "code.cleanup.on.save": "true", "full.screen.before.presentation.mode": "false", "git-widget-placeholder": "master", "last_opened_file_path": "D:/Synchronized/Active-Projects/LifeSim/utils", "node.js.detected.package.eslint": "true", "node.js.selected.package.eslint": "(autodetect)", "nodejs_package_manager_path": "npm", "rearrange.code.on.save": "true", "run.code.analysis.last.selected.profile": "pProject Default", "settings.editor.selected.configurable": "preferences.pluginManager", "typescript.add.unambiguous.imports.on.the.fly": "true", "vue.rearranger.settings.migration": "true" }, "keyToStringList": { "com.intellij.ide.scratch.ScratchImplUtil$2/New Scratch File": [ "AsciiDoc" ] } }

task.summary: Default task

Windows Build
- Got build process working on Windows - Cleaned up CMake config - I broke the executable though

Windows Build
- Got build process working on Windows - Cleaned up CMake config - Added .dll and .dylib files to repo - Fixed runtime error for Windows platform - Adjusted window size and application name - Organized source files into appropriate folders

Windows Specific Build
- Added Windows-specific modifications to build process - Renamed 'modules' folder to 'source'

Entity Component System Implementation
- Implemented an ECS control architecture via ECSManager - Abstracted away GUI rendering to Renderer - Abstracted away program initialization to Application - Added Roboto font - BUG// Still working out some build issues due to implementation errors

Working Render Pipeline
- Fixed build issues & circular references - Added common.h file to encapsulate global declarations - Created RenderSystem to handle rendering shapes at entity position - Start position and velocity are now randomly selected

Header File Splitting
- Extracted implementation details into .cpp files

Fixed Global Variable
- Improved code formatting - Fixed circular reference issues when trying to access g_Application global variable across header files - Removed `static` from Renderer class methods

Added multithreading support to CollisionSystem
- Collisions now processed on multiple threads - Mutex lock used to prevent more than one collision being logged at one time

Better Abstractions
- Abstracted random number generation to Random class - Changed ImVec2 types used outside Renderer to Position type - Created specialized template class methods for drawing various types of basic shapes - Updated shape generation logic to inset shape variations into the rectangle circumscribed by the entity position, height, & width - Added Collider data to RenderSystem so shapes can be rendered based on their collider size - Hoisted entity creation in ECSManager constructor - Bug// Currently a problem running the program - it builds, but the window never appears

Added GLEW but having Linking issues - WIP
- Abstracted away Random value generation to Random class - Fixed program lockup when using Random class in ECSManager constructor - Other minor naming and type tweaks

Added vcpkg for managing dependencies
- Removed unused dependency files - Extracted functions and macros from `CMakeLists.txt` for cleaner script - Replaced raw dependency files for ImGui and vcpkg with Git submodules - Created setup scripts for Windows & Unix to configure submodules and initialize vcpkg - Automated installation of dependencies with vcpkg manifest file - Minor fixes for MSVC compile errors
Removed unnecessary committed dependencies

Removed unnecessary committed dependencies
- Cleaned up CMake files

Decoupled render loop and compute loop
- Added fixed timestep compute loop - Render loop now runs separately at monitor refresh rate - Disabled WorldManager - Updated class members to use "m_" naming convention

Style Improvements
- Reformat code style - Streamlined CMake presets - Regenerated .clang-format

Style Improvements
- Reformat code style - Streamlined CMake presets - Regenerated .clang-format
Added Dockerfile to setup Linux profiler toolchain
Added Dockerfile to setup Linux profiler toolchain

Added performance metrics and debug GUI
- Changed push_back() to emplace_back() - Optimized more function arguments - Changed ENTITY_COUNT to a `size_t constexpr` global and moved to `Common.h` - Defined OpenGL error callback - Changed window background to black - Renamed some methods

Entities bounce off viewport
- Updated ScreenToViewport to grab the actual window size from GLFW - Fixed bug in `CollisionSystem` causing imprecise collision bounding box - Added new `CollisionSystem::isOutOfBounds()` method - Update entities to bounce off viewport boundaries - Added `Debounce()`` helper function - Added `IsEqual<T>()`, `IsGreaterThanOrEqual<T>()`, and `IsLessThanOrEqual<T>()` generic helper functions

Entities contained within viewport
- Fixed scaling and offset of ImGui geometry to ensure entities stay within viewport bounds and do not re-scale with the GLFW window - Updated variable declarations to use uniform initializer where possible _(Hoping this will make them reserve memory on the stack instead of the heap)_ - Tweaked performance metrics panel to have proper size and functionality - Added OpenGL error handling macros - Updated `Renderer::ScreenToViewport()` to be static method

Improved entity<->boundary bounce calculation
- Added constructors to Position and Velocity structs to more easily convert from ImVec2 types _(I'll eventually refactor Position and Velocity to use a more generalizable custom Vector 2 type)_ - Added new ImMath namespace containing basic Vector 2 math operations - Improved Debounce function to support tracking multiple debounce streams from unique call sites - Updated `Debounce` function `callback` argument to accept a `std::string id` argument in case the callback needs to reference the unique identifier for debounce - Improved how entities bounce off viewport boundaries to respect the angle of incidence for a proper "reflection" bounce

Fixed MSVC compile issues & Greatly improved performance with threads
- Created new ThreadPool utility class - Fixed performance issues by using new ThreadPool class to make CollisionSystem and MovementSystem more efficient. No longer starts and kills a large number of threads each frame - Fixed issues with MSVC build toolchain and defined new CMake presets - Cleaned up CMake build flags to avoid compiler warnings and only use debug flags in debug mode - Removed unused WorldManager class - Updated member variable naming scheme to be consistent across all classes: m_PascalCase for public variables and m_camelCase for private ones

User Input
- Added new transition smoothing functions to ImMath namespace: Lerp, Dampen, and EaseInOut - Implemented zoom support with scalable entities & smooth interpolation - Up/Down arrow keys zoom In/Out - Working on responding to user scroll and keyboard events - Working on splitting program into dedicated physics & render threads

ServiceContainer & Improved Collision
- Implemented ServiceContainer class to encapsulate singleton instances used throughout the program - Bound Renderer class to ServiceCounter - Renamed Renderer methods to be simpler and use proper capitalization conventions - Added new ImMath functions: Magnitude(), Distance(), ImVec2 Lerp(), and ImVec2& Invert() - Updated README.md - Fixed compiled errors due to missing Service constructor - Added utils folder to included directories so utilities can be imported using angle bracket syntax - Fixed compile errors in ServiceContainer class when split across .h and .cpp files _(merged into a single header file)_

- Added public m_FrameCount member variable to Application class for future instrumentation - Created new InputManager class to handle processing mouse and keyboard input - Created Instrumentation class to handle measuring debug metrics like FPS & Frame Count - Split InputManager into header and cpp files - Converted m_InputManager and m_ECSManager Application member variables into ServiceContainer pointers - Abstracted 90% of frame logic out of Application class

GLFW Callbacks
- Replaced polling for window size changes and replaced with GLFW callbacks - Moved callbacks into Renderer

OpenGL 3
- Updated ImGui backend to use OpenGL 3 - Trying out new code style

Entry point manages Application lifecycle
- Replaced global Application variable with ServiceContainer - Updated ServiceContainer::Resolve references to be scope wrapped to ensure the shared pointer is released when no longer needed - LifeSim entrypoint now maintains Application ownership for program lifecycle - Added explicit code to reset Application pointer on program completion - Modified code style a bit to use combination of K&R and BSD brace layout

More GLFW Callbacks
- Replaced iostream `std::cout` and `std::cerr` with `fprintf` calls for better formatting - Refactored Renderer to persist framebuffer and window size as class member variables - Added more GLFW callbacks to update window property fields on change - Refactored Renderer::ScreenToViewport() to use class fields instead of polling window properties - Added FPS and frame time averages from ImGui to debug metrics panel - Tweaked code style again, trying to find something I'm happy with
Moved Math operations into the ImMath namespace

Triple Buffer Prep - WIP
Program is currently crashing at runtime due to dereferencing a null pointer
- Cleaned up imports for all classes to fix circular dependencies - Moved all constructor implementations from header files to cpp files to avoid breaking forward declarations - Added constructor log statements - Created a shared `physicsBufferMutex` to pass around for write access to `physicsBuffer` - Moved calculation of available threads to `MAX_HARDWARE_THREADS` global constant - Created new `SwapBuffer()` method in `ECSManager` - Updated entity id's to use unsigned integers - Created new `EntityData` struct to hold copies of all data regarding entities and their properties - Refactored entity data to use more efficient std::array data structures - Created triple buffer architecture with RenderBuffer, PhysicsBufferRead, and PhysicsBufferWrite - Fixed bugs in overloaded ServiceContainer constructors
Trying out std::format and std::print

MESSAGE.value:
Fixed Global Variable
- Improved code formatting - Fixed circular reference issues when trying to access g_Application global variable across header files - Removed `static` from Renderer class methods

Added multithreading support to CollisionSystem
- Collisions now processed on multiple threads - Mutex lock used to prevent more than one collision being logged at one time

Better Abstractions
- Abstracted random number generation to Random class - Changed ImVec2 types used outside Renderer to Position type - Created specialized template class methods for drawing various types of basic shapes - Updated shape generation logic to inset shape variations into the rectangle circumscribed by the entity position, height, & width - Added Collider data to RenderSystem so shapes can be rendered based on their collider size - Hoisted entity creation in ECSManager constructor - Bug// Currently a problem running the program - it builds, but the window never appears

Added GLEW but having Linking issues - WIP
- Abstracted away Random value generation to Random class - Fixed program lockup when using Random class in ECSManager constructor - Other minor naming and type tweaks

Added vcpkg for managing dependencies
- Removed unused dependency files - Extracted functions and macros from `CMakeLists.txt` for cleaner script - Replaced raw dependency files for ImGui and vcpkg with Git submodules - Created setup scripts for Windows & Unix to configure submodules and initialize vcpkg - Automated installation of dependencies with vcpkg manifest file - Minor fixes for MSVC compile errors
